title: Formula 1
abstract: Mexico Grand Prix 2022 live coverage and box office website
process:
As a part of the preparatives for the Mexico Grand Prix 2022, F1 wanted to give their website a fresher look so fans could follow up the event on these celebration days.

The purpose of the renewal was to enhance the interactive aspects of the box office so people can have a better look to the new areas and aminities in the Mexico City racetrack. Alongside to new sections in the website including a full live coverage of the event, and with this create a more attractive experience to incentivize people to join the event and follow up the celebration.

We started gathering information from the previous app and evaluated the problems the users had working with it. We did user interviews to evaluate their experience and what they think would be helpful to add/update in the software. We researched about a typical POS software, did some competitive analysis and created a mood board for necessary features to cover in the software.
The main screen was divided into 3 sections: navbar, sidebar and items section. Here are some initial lo-fi wireframes.
To maintain consistency and ensure efficient design to dev handover, We made a modular design system based on reusable components.

After trying some fonts, colors & icons, we started building hi-fi wireframes. We put the focus on the 'Orders page' where users can manage the orders, and continued with the ensuing pages such as 'billing page' and 'New order'.
The software was created from scratch using react in the front end and node.js cliet side. It was designed as a typical MVC model implementing a REST interface.

The renovation of the website bring several key benefits, increased engagement one of them, as it can lead to more user interaction and more social media shares, helping F1 reach new audiences.

Furthermore the addition of new sections and features like live coverage and a robust box office incentivizes people to attend the Mexico Grand Prix and purchase tickets, resulting in increased revenue for F1 and creating a positive experience for fans.

These updates help F1 better track and analyze important metrics such as website traffic, user behavior, and ticket sales. This information can be used to make data-driven decisions and optimize the website, making it a valuable investment.

title: Cartoober
abstract: Stream as an animated avatar from your browser
process: For new content creators, the main obstacle to begin in the streaming industry is not having the best equipment. Cartober aims to simplify streaming video creation for new content creators by providing virtual avatars as a solution to the obstacle of lacking the best equipment. It offers a cross-platform service with a focus on performance and accessibility to make the video creation process easier and more accessible to users.

We started gathering information from the previous app and evaluated the problems the users had working with it. We did user interviews to evaluate their experience and what they think would be helpful to add/update in the software. We researched about a typical POS software, did some competitive analysis and created a mood board for necessary features to cover in the software.
The main screen was divided into 3 sections: navbar, sidebar and items section. Here are some initial lo-fi wireframes.
To maintain consistency and ensure efficient design to dev handover, We made a modular design system based on reusable components.

After trying some fonts, colors & icons, we started building hi-fi wireframes. We put the focus on the 'Orders page' where users can manage the orders, and continued with the ensuing pages such as 'billing page' and 'New order'.
The software was created from scratch using react in the front end and node.js cliet side. It was designed as a typical MVC model implementing a REST interface.

Cartoober is the result of combining cutting-edge technologies like React for building a scalable and flexible front-end, Pixi.js, a 2D rendering engine, to create high-performance graphics and animations, Tensorflow, a machine learning library, for realistic facial expressions and movements for the virtual avatars, and RTMP communication to ensure real-time communication between the platform and viewers.

With the integration of these technologies, Cartoober not only provides an accessible solution for new VTubers, but also allows them to easily stream to multiple social media platforms like YouTube and Facebook, opening new possibilities for content creation and allowing them to reach a wider audience.

abstract: Linking in-person and virtual events in an immersive platform

By offering virtual tools to enhance the experience, Crosslink Venues expands the possibilities of event creation and eliminates the boundaries between in-person and virtual events. This approach offers not only a replacement for in-person events, but also an extension of the experience, creating new opportunities for event planners and attendees alike.

The idea of bridging the gap between physical and virtual events was a unique and challenging task, requiring innovative solutions to recreate the atmosphere of an event in a virtual space. This provided an opportunity for the team to showcase their creativity.

Additionally, the increasing trend of virtual events due to the pandemic has made Crosslink Venues a timely and relevant solution for the event industry. By offering a set of tools, not only acts as a replacement for in-person events, but also extends the experience by providing new and exciting possibilities for attendees.

Crosslink Venues opens up new avenues for hosting events and offers a unique solution to the challenges posed by the pandemic. It provides a platform for event organizers to host events in a virtual space, allowing them to reach a wider audience, save on costs and provide attendees with an immersive experience.

title: Profuturo
abstract: Turning training process into an interactive experience
process:

However, from employees point of view, this situation is not so obvious and sometimes they are not aware of how tiring it can be for the clients.

In order to provide better quality service to all clients, this project is designed for employees to empathize with their clients, by evidencing from the training process the step by step of each procedure but from the client's point of view, emphasizing the difficulties they may face during legal proceedings, through an interactive experience.

title: Robix UML
abstract: Simplify software requirements specification by rising robustness analysis adoption
process:
As a result of prioritizing working software over comprehensive documentation, a common problem in agile software teams is the lack of documentation, resulting in fast developement projects but unsustainable maintenance.

Focusing on requirements specification, Scrumconix, a agile methodology, proposes to use the robustness analysis as the main artifact for requirements specification, since it allows sufficient documentation while maintaining an agile approach. However, due to its low presence in popular methodologies, the use of this type of diagram is not very widespread.

The challenge was to design a tool that would raise the adoption of this diagram, part of a study aimed to reduce the lack of documentation in software teams.

During this phase we scheduled meetings with the client to agree on the app features based on its needs. Moreover, since the diagram and the methodology it comes from where unfamiliar to the team, it was necessary to do research on it.

Being the main funcionality to create a diagram, we focus the UI on the canvas. Keeping this in mind, this component occupies the entire screen, thus the user can visualize a greater number of elements of the diagram.

Robix UML is a web based application that works entierly client side, it was build using React and is made out of two parts: A view layer, consisting of the UI elements that the user interacts with, and a business logic layer, which defines the behaviour of the diagram elements.

This project aimed to address a common problem in agile software development, the lack of comprehensive documentation. By focusing on the use of the robustness analysis diagram as the main artifact for requirements specification, the project sought to provide a solution that balances the need for sufficient documentation with the agility of the development process.

The solution introduced a tool that promotes the adoption of the robustness analysis diagram, helping software teams to create comprehensive documentation while maintaining an agile approach. Additionally, the ability to convert the diagram into a use case model and to allow multiple users to collaborate in real-time on the creation of diagrams, makes it a valuable tool by facilitating better collaboration and improving the documentation process.
